loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 22-year-old married woman from Al Russwifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy makeup and perfumes to resell to her friends and neighbors in her area.  She would like to help her husband to increase their income. She hopes in the future to open a shop by increasing her products.

Since Ilham is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a 22-year-old married female from Al Nasser in Jordan.  She has 3 children.  Doaa requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing in cosmetics and perfumes.  In the future, she is looking forward to open her own shop instead of working from home and to improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Doaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and perfurmes to resell

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Khitam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Khitam is a 33-year-old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy materials for her grocery store such as foodstuff to resell.  She wants to expand her business by increase her products. She hopes in the future to buy cleaning products and mobile cards to resell.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Dos Corazones Unidos-25 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario DOS CORAZONES UNIDOS-25 está  compuesto por tres integrantes dos  mujeres y un varón,   el coordinador del  grupo  es el Sr.  Freddy tiene 32 años es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 11 y el otro de 16 años, el  se dedica al transporte público, tiene un minibús  y su mujer trabaja como comerciante vendiendo aretes, collares etc. Su domicilio que se encuentran en la zona de barrio Minasa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Freddy va a usar este préstamo hacer mantenimiento a su vehículo, por que las llantas reventaron y sin su vehículo no puede trabajar, por ahora están subsistiendo con el negocio de la esposa,  Freddy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son como trabaja con transporte público siempre tiene contratiempos que  le perjudica bastante para sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su vehículo para que pueda trabajar y generar mejores ingresos y así de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia Freddy anhela mas que nada lograr que sus hijos salgan profesionales, por lo cual esta priorizando el financiar sus estudios. En la foto el Sr. freddy se encuentra en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en:
The joint group Dos Corazones Unidos-25 (Two Hearts United-25) is made up of three members, two women and a man. The coordinator of the group is Freddy. He is 32 years old and married with 2 children; one is 11 and the other is 16. He works in public transportation; he has a minibus and his wife works as a shopkeeper selling earrings, necklaces, etc. His home is located in the neighborhood of Minasa. This loan is his first cycle in the organization. 

Freddy is going to use this loan for maintenance of his vehicle, because the tires burst and without his vehicle he can’t work. For now they are living off his wife’s business. Freddy faces challenges in his business, which are, as he works in public transportation, he always has setbacks that harm him greatly for his earnings. 

He is going to use the profits to continue improving his vehicle so that he can work and generate better income, and in this way improve his family’s quality of life. Freddy wishes more than anything for his children to become professionals, for which reason he is giving priority to financing their education. In the photo, Freddy is next to his wife.

loans.use: with vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 36-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She runs an eatery selling cooked food to the people in her community.

Gloria has been in the business for more than eight years now.  She dreams of expanding her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. As of now, she is asking for a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy more cooking ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, seasoning, and other items. Though this, she will be able to cook more food to sell thus allowing her to earn more and save more for the future schooling of her four-year-old daughter.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of five school-aged children from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. Jocelyn has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. Her husband also works as a farmer. They grow rice, corn and bananas in their field.

Jocelyn is requesting for a loan worth 9000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the plants, pay for the rent and maintenance of the machinery used on the farm, and to buy school materials for her children.

Jocelyn dreams of expanding her farming business in the future.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, farm equipment costs, and school supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of an eleven-year-old son. She and her husband are engaged in a farming business for more than 20 years now. Aside from that, her husband also runs a habal-habal or motorcycle transport business. These are the only sources of their income.

Judith is requesting for a loan worth 10000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the plants and other farming equipment like a sprayer. Through this, they will be able to increase their yield in the farm thus giving them a higher income.

Judith hopes of making her business sustainable. Moreover, she wants to continually support her son’s education.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farming equipment

loans.name: Labito

texts.en:
Labito is a 50-year -old married man and father of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. Labito is a fisherman and has been in this business for more than 20 years now. This is the only source of his income.

Labito wants to improve his fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Labito is requesting for a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat. He is optimistic that through this loan, he will be able to improve his daily catch, thus giving him a chance of selling more fish to the market.

Labito hopes of experiencing fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: buy fishing nets and boat fuel

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of three young children from Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. Lorna is engaged in a food vending business. She cooks food and sells it to the people in her place. She also runs a sari-sari or convenience store selling various goods.

Lorna is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business, such as lour, sugar, butter, milk, and groceries to sell in her store. Lorna believes that she can improve her business through this loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale and restock her store

loans.name: Ma. Bona

texts.en:
Ma. Bona is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of two school-aged children from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in seaweed farming. Her husband also works as a fisherman. Ma. Bona has been in the business for more than 6 years now. Seaweed are cultured and farmed in many regions in the country. It is  valued not just as food but also as a raw material for making wares such as pails, basins, and others.

Ma. Bona plans of expanding her business but lacks money to do so. She is applying for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy straws, seaweed seedlings and fuel for the fishing boat.

Ma. Bona hopes of making her business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of her family and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy seaweed farming supplies and boat fuel

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a sari-sari or convenience store business for more than five years now. 

Elsa is applying for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack food, sodas and others. Through this, Elsa will be able to attract more buyers in her store.

Elsa dreams of  making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of five young children from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a farming business for more than ten years now. Her husband also works as a farmer.

Ma. Lilibeth is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her plants. Through this, she will be able to increase her yield in the farm. In the future, Ma. Lilibeth dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Verna

texts.en:
Ma. Verna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Verna requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Ma. Verna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Herbert De Jesus

texts.es:
Herbert, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde, él tiene 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres a través de la granja logra ayudar a sus padres con algunos ingresos para cubrir gastos del hogar, el inició su negocio hace dos años con el apoyo de sus padres hoy en día ha adquirido experiencia y lo maneja solo.

El necesita de un préstamo para comprarse 200 pollos pequeños y el alimento (concentrado) para un periodo de tiempo, ya que aumentará así la granja para la temporada que se acerca en la cual realiza los clientes una mayor demanda, este préstamo le permitirá fortalecerse en el negocio y tener más capacidad.
texts.en:
Herbert has a farm for raising chickens. He is 20 years old and he lives with his parents. Through the farm, he is able to help his parents with some revenue to cover household costs. He started his business two years ago with the support of his parents. Currently, he has acquired experience and he manages it by himself.

He needs a loan to purchase 200 small chickens and food (chicken feed) for a period of time, since in this way he will expand the farm for the coming season in which his customers have a greater demand. This loan will allow him to strengthen his business and have more capital.

loans.use: to purchase 200 small chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en:
Madelene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

NWTF is presenting Madelene's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta is 58 years old and married with seven children.  Maritta is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies.

Maritta has been farming rice for eleven years now and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has run a sari-sari or convenience store for more than six years now. She is 38 years old, married and has four young children. Her husband is a farmer growing rice and other crops in their field.

Marites plans of expanding her business. She is applying for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, noodles, canned goods, soda, detergents, shampoo and many more. Through this, Marites will be able to attract more customers nad buyers in her store.

In the future, Marites wants to improve her business. Moroever, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mateo	Sr.

texts.en:
Mateo is a 58-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been in this business for more than 30 years now. This is the  only source of his income.

Mateo is requesting for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat and other supplies.  Mateo hopes of making his business successful in the future. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa is 47 years old and lives with her 3 children and husband in Bulgan province in Mongolia.  For 24 years her husband works in the Orkhon Soum as a forest patrol officer. Her older daughter moved out from the house but the younger children still live with them. They live in an apartment. 

Baigalmaa  started her own business to sell vegetables at a rented counter of a store since July of this year. The rental payment is 500,000 MNT. It is  an affordable price within the central area in Mongolia.  Baigalmaa is asking a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetables for her business. She is planning to purchase 3 tons of potatoes and 1.5 tons of carrots by wholesale rate.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 26-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the rice farming business for more than 2 years now.

Michael is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the crops that he is growing. With this, he will be able to produce a good harvest from his farm, thus allowing him to sell more to the market.

Michael hopes of making his business sustainable so that it will augment his income and he can help his parents.

loans.use: buy fertlizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of four young children, aged 11, 8, 6 and a 1-year old baby.

Teresa and her husband are engaged in a farming business for more than five years now. Teresa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Teresa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice that they are growing. With this, they will be able enhance their yield in the farm.  In the future, Teresa hopes of improving their farming venture and make it more sustainable. Furthermore, she wants to save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Although it is not attended by the head, all events run smoothly because Ni Wayan (as Treasurer) and Ni Made (as secretary) are responsible for the loan.

The Kertha Bakti group continues to increase their businesses and with the support of their family, they hope their businesses will be growing and able to be independent in terms of capital.

Ni Wayan, 24, is a housewife with one child. Her husband works as a farmer. This loan is used to purchase more piglets and feeds. In addition to raising pigs, Ni Wayan also has a business selling snacks and vegetables. In this effort, she hopes to renovate her home to avoid leaks in the rainy season.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and married with 5 children.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 51 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She is engage in selling plasticware and kitchen utensils in the market. She has been in this business for 20 years, since getting married.

Nena started capital for her business with PHP 7,000. She worked hard to reach her dream of having her own stall. With the support of her husband, they manage well their business, from which they get their daily consumption for their house through the profits they earned. Nena is also able to send her children to school. 

With her determination to succeed and to finish sending her children to the college level of education, Nena wants to extend the products she sells in the market. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy blankets, mosquito nets, and bed sheets. She hopes to see her children wearing professionals’ uniforms someday.

loans.use: buy blankets, mosquito nets, and bed sheets

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 35-year-old private school proprietor in Miritini, Mombasa. She is married and has been running this business for the past eight years. Her business is doing great.

This is Linda’s Fourth loan from KADET LTD. She is requesting for an asset loan to buy furniture for her school. She is planning to purchase a nursery table, benches and painting chairs.   She hopes to see the nursery school children learning in a more comfortable and conducive environment.

loans.use: buy a nursery table, benches and painting chairs

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.ru:
Курбон 32 летний гражданин Таджикистана. Он проживает в районе Бохтар. Курбон женат. Он является отцом четверых детей. Курбон живет в одном доме вместе с братом и его семьей. Жена Курбона работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Она в основном собирает хлопок. 
Курбон имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он шафер. Курбон обратился в Хумо за кредитом, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Он хочет заняться частным извозом на своем автомобиле. 
Курбон просит кредит для приобретения легковой автомашины марки "Opel".
texts.en:
Qurbon is a 32-year-old citizen of Tajikistan. He lives in the Bohtar district.  He is married and the father of four children.  He lives in a house which he shares with his brother and his brother's family.  Qurbon's wife works in the farming sector, mainly harvesting cotton.

Qurbon attended a specialized high school and he is a professional driver.  He has turned to HUMO for a loan, in order to start his own business.  He wants to get involved in private transportation services using his own car.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a passenger car (an Opel).

loans.use: to purchase a passenger car (Opel brand).

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Nazira obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. As Nazira’s activity is running successfully and her clientele has increased, she is applying for a second Kiva loan of 50,000 Kyrgyzstan Soms (KGS) to broaden the winter range of clothes in her shop.

loans.use: to broaden the winter range of goods in her shop.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin is 38-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four young children. Edralin has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than three years now. 

Edralin works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children. As of now, she is asking for a loan worth 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the plants. She believes that through this loan, she can improve her harvest and yield from the farm.

In the future, Edralin wants to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the plants.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, tiene a su esposa, todos viven juntos, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, lo aprendió hace 30 años con su padre, trabaja desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.

Solicita un préstamo para poderse comprar los materiales necesarios para poder mejorar y fortalecer el cultivo, comprándose abono, herbicidas esto ayudara para que él tenga a la mano todo lo necesario y realizar la siembra aplicando los insumos que le daran una mejor produccion.
Su aspiración es ayudar a su familia, especialmente a su hijo, que pueda estudiar, además quiere fortalecer los cultivos, aumentando la cosecha.
texts.en:
Carlos plants and grows corn and beans. He lives with his wife and three-year-old son. Carlos learned his trade 30 years ago from his father. He works from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M.

Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can buy the necessary materials for improving and strengthening his crops. He will acquire compost and herbicides so that he will have all of his supplies on hand and apply them during planting so that he can achieve better production.

His aspiration is to help his family, especially securing an education for his son. In addition, he wants to strengthen his crops and increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 38 years old and married. She has four school-aged children. Emelyn has a food stall where she sells cooked food in the community. Emelyn has had this business for four years, and she earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients to cook more dishes to sell. In the future, Emelyn hopes that her business will improve to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Susana Amalia

texts.es: Susana de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos . Susana se compro una vitrina y perchas de allí ella vende laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Y Ella cuenta que quisiera arreglar su vivienda y el sueño de ella es comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar: artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,cuadernos  etc.
texts.en:
Susana is single and has two children. She bought a display cabinet and hangers so that she could begin selling everything from decals and notebooks to bazaar items. Susana manages her small business by herself. She begins work at 8:00 A.M. and continues to 10:00 P.M. At first her neighborhood experienced frequent crime, so her business was not very productive. Over time the conditions gradually improved and now she is doing very well in her business. Her dream is to expand her business even more so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers who shop at her bazaar each day. She would like to remodel her home and also dreams of buying a car.

With this loan Susana will buy bazaar items, paper, decals, notebooks, and other products.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items, paper, decals, notebooks, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: José de estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos. José comenta que con la ayuda de su padre que le dieron la capital él se puso una panadería donde hace tortas, panes, bocaditos. El trabaja todos las tardes  con sus padres. Con el préstamo El va a comprar:  harina, mantequilla, manteca , huevos, etc.
texts.en: José is single and does not have any children. José says that with the help of his father, who gave him the capital, he started a bakery where he makes cakes, breads and snacks. He works with his parents every afternoon. With this loan, José is going to buy flour, butter, lard, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, lard, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 35 years old, married and has two children she is sending to school. Her children are in the elementary level of education. Luzviminda manages a clothing business in the market. She usually sells pants and shirts.

Luzviminda’s husband is a rolling vendor of posters and educational books in different marketplaces during market days. A Luzviminda priority in life is to uplift their living conditions and give a better life to her family. No matter how hard it is to work, she will strive to make her priority a reality.

Luzviminda is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (P) to buy baby dresses, jackets and casual attire to sell in the market. She hopes to improve her business and earn income to sustain their needs.

loans.use: to buy baby dresses, jackets and casual attire to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer for her field and feed for her ducks.

NWTF is relisting Marieta's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her field and feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. Her primary sources of income are milk, crops, and a salary job. She has three children and has been doing this work for ten years. 

Her favourite part of farming is poultry. She loves poultry and enjoys feeding them! Her biggest challenge is disease that can lead to the death of a large amount of birds. Animals on the farm have been given the names 'Tina.' She will use the loan to buy poultry. 

Monicah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan after she got information from other existing clients. After Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Monicah said she learned about how to invest in farming and increase her income.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Monica said that she will get more income which she will use to send her children to school.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Monica owns a cow, poultry, pump, and automobile but does not own a pig, bicycle, or motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards that may come from a loan. This borrower has a mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en: Balqees is a 30-year-old independent and hardworking woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, daughter and two sons. Her husband is a peon and one son is a student. Her husband's income is not sufficient to cover household expenditures. Therefore, since 2010 Balqees is trying to help him by making candles at home. She sells her handmade candles in the market from which she gets a good amount of income to meet daily household expenses. She is interested in growing her business. She is a member of an eight-person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase candle-making materials like wax, wax oil, wax color and some candle-making tools so that she can work more professionally and efficiently and can easily grow her business. She dreams for her children's better future and husband's good health. She wants to live a good and simple life with her family. Salam and many thanks from her to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note: In the picture Balqees holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase candle-making products for her handmade candle business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has been a hog raiser for eight years. She is from the village of Villa Marzo, Cordon. Marites is happily married to Florencio. The couple was blessed with four children: two are studying, and the other two are working.

Marites manages a livestock business, and at the same time, buys and resells frozen foods such as hot dogs and dressed chicken. Her main goal is to increase her profit to be able to educate her two children and provide them comfortable living conditions. 

Marites plans to buy two additional piglets and their daily hog feed maintenance, but her capital is not enough. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She hopes to get this amount of loan so she could achieve her goal in life and with her business.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and hog feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Om-Wsam Group

texts.en:
Om-Wsam is a group which consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen.
Khatma is 28 years old, single and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her educational background is secondary school. She has a house for which she wants to buy home appliances. So, she is requesting a loan of 30000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator. She also hopes to buy a furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and furniture for her house.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and married with nine children.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

Luzviminda has been farming vegetables for seven years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain his business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El Sr. Wilson tiene 36 años y tiene seis hijos de las edades de 1, 3, 7, 10, 12 y 15 años, el se dedica  a  la venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Zanja honda este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Wilson va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, el Sr. Wilson enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Wilson is 36 years old and has six children who are 1, 3, 7, 10, 12 and 15 years old. He sells and raises pigs in the locality of Zonja. This is his first loan through Emprender. Wilson is going to use this loan to buy pigs for his business. His reason for requesting this loan is because he lacks the capital to buy pigs. Wilson faces challenges in his business such as how to improve his quality of life. He is going to use this assistance to improve the quality of his pigs' diet. His wish is to have a farm where he can raise more pigs, so that he will be able to improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, este negocio de Claudia es la venta al por mayor de la entrega de tortillas, en el mercado de la ciudad, lo aprendió de su familia y tiene mas de 15 años de realizarlo.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz por mayor cantidad, facilitándole un mejor precio, además dará mantenimiento a la cocina donde las elabora, esta será una gran ayuda para que ella pueda tener su negocio muy completo.

La aspiración de ella es poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida a través del desarrollo del negocio, logrando ayudar  con lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Claudia sells tortillas. She is a single mother who lives with her children (ages 20 and 25). Claudia’s business involves serving and selling tortillas in bulk at the city market. She learned this trade from her family and has been in business for more than 15 years.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy corn in bulk quantities. This will allow her to obtain the best price. In addition, she will maintain the stove on which she prepares her tortillas. This will be a great help since she will be able to have a complete business.

Claudia’s aspiration is to provide a better quality of life for her family by developing her business and helping them obtain what they need the most.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk quantities and to pay for the maintenance of her stove.

loans.name: Senami Célestine

texts.fr: Agée de 37ans, Senami Célestine est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. Elle vend des sachets dans l'un des marchés de la ville depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes à l'extérieur. En vue d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Le profit dégagé par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: 37 years old, Senami Célestine is married and the mother of three children who all attend school. The eldest is 18 and the youngest 12 years old. She sells plastic bags in one of the markets in town and has been doing so for several years. She buys her stock from a wholesaler outside the town. In order to increase the quantity she is able to purchase and to be able to meet the demand she gets, she has sought and obtained financing from Finadev. The profit earned from this funding will allow her to help cover the childrens' schooling fees and to meet her general living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase twenty packs of one dozen plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Elle s’appelle Seynabou, elle est âgée de 57 ans et elle loge dans un petit village située aux environs de 7km de la ville principale. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce et cela depuis 5 ans déjà .Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F CFA avec lesquels elle va acheter du pain de singe, du charbon, des mangues, du lait caillé pour aller revendre cela sur la route principale qui mène à leur village, une route qui est bien fréquentée. Elle commence sa journée à 7h 30mn pour la finir à 19h 30mn.
Elle participe aux charges de la famille. Avec l’amélioration de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vies de ses enfants et subvenir à leur besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Seynabou is 57 years old and lives in a small village some seven kilometres from the main city. She has been a local trader for the last five years.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA with which she intends to purchase monkey bread tree (or baobab) fruit, charcoal, mangoes and curds. She will resell these items on the main road leading into the village, a busy well-used road.
Her day begins at 7.30am and finishes at 7.30pm. She helps with the family expenses. By improving her business, she plans to improve the living conditions for her children and to meet all their regular needs.

loans.use: to purchase baobab tree fruit, mangoes, charcoal and curds to retail.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y activa.  Es viuda ya varios años y vive con sus 02 hijos en su propia casa que logró comprar con la ayuda de su difunto esposo. El trabajo que realiza Ynes es la compra y venta de ropa interior femenina de diversas modelos, y son ofrecidos a sus clientes entre ellos amistades y vecinos de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulante y reparto a domicilio, lleva como 04 años en éste negocio y hasta el momento le generado buenas ganancias. Se siente muy contenta porque le ha traido muchas satisfcciones, ya que gracias a ello ha logrado sustentar su hogar y ampliar asu negocio. Este este es su tecer crédito con MFP y espera comprar mayor cantidad de ropa femenina y lencería en diversos modelos y en mayor cantidad y a menor precio. así tendrá mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ynes, 60, is a happy and active woman.  She has been a widow for a number of years, and she lives with her two sons in her own house, which she bought with the help of her deceased husband. Ynes sells different kinds of lingerie to her clients, among them friends and neighbors in the area where she lives.  She sells door-to-door and from her home and has been carrying on this business for four years, always generating a good income. She is pleased because this work has enabled her to maintain her home and to increase her business.

This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she wants to buy better quality women's clothing and lingerie in different models and in bulk at a lower price so as to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and lingerie.

loans.name: Chantal Sènami

texts.fr: Chantal Sènami est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal Sènami est mariée à un certain Mathieu. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chantal Sènami vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Chantal Sènami mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la coiffure d façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Chantal Sènami vend des bijoux et des chaussures. Chantal Sènami s’approvisionne dans certaines villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Chantal Sènami sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Chantal Sènami is 32 years old and lives in Bénin. She is married to a man named Mathieu. They have three children, and they all attend school. Chantal Sènami lives at home together with her husband and children, and meets the household expenses along with her husband. 
In order to cover the various costs, she has worked as a mobile hairdresser for the last ten years or so. Alongside this business, she also sells jewelry and shoes. She buys her stock in selected towns in Bénin.
In order to meet her customers demand and to grow her income and her profit, she is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the third time. This loan will undoubtedly help her to grow her business and to increase her profits. The previous loans have both been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 47 años y tiene dos hijos de las edades de 22 y 17 años, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Villa Florida,  este préstamo es el su decima secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Jose va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa, yuca  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia, el Sr. Jose es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jose is 47 years old and has two children who are 22 and 17 years old. He works in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables, including potato and yucca, on his land located in the community of Villa Florida. This loan is his tenth with Emprender. Jose is going to use this loan to buy seeds for planting potatoes and yucca and to prepare the land. He is requesting this loan in order to have the necessary resources for the planting and to be able to subsist. Jose faces challenges in his business, such as inclement weather that on many occasions can ruin the crops. He will use the benefits of this loan to improve his and his family's quality of life. Jose is a very responsible and hard working person and he feels grateful to be offered this assistance.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and harvest yucca

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is a widow with four grown up children. All her four children have settled down in marriage and are living separately from her. Her husband died due to illness. Prescila started her general store in the year 2003. Profits gained from this business were used to cover all their basic necessities in life and some were used for the medication of her late husband.

Prescila would like to increase her stocks of groceries to further improve her financial stability and to recover for her lost profits. With regards to this situation, she is asking for a bigger capital amount of PHP 40,000. This loan amount would really be of great help most especially in satisfying her customer demand and improving her financial situation. In addition, she could save some amount for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for her general store business

loans.name: Djromahuton 15 Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON 15 est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Bernadette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Kiki. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Bernadette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Bernadette n’a pas été à l’école.  Il y a près de quinze ans que Bernadette mène comme activité la vente de maïs à son domicile. Bernadette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Bernadette sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON 15. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DJROMAHUTON 15 is a group of five people; the members are all friends living in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Bernadette (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 32 years old and is married to a man named Kiki. They have four children, all in school. Bernadette and her husband live together, along with their children, and they share the task of meeting the household budget. Bernadette did not go to school. 
For almost fifteen years now, she has sold corn from her home. She does this with great passion, and it allows her to meet her needs and those of her children. She buys the corn in the outlying areas of Bénin.
In order to meet consumer demand, she is requesting a first loan - together with the other members of the DJROMAHUTON 15 group. This loan will help them all to better meet their customers needs and also to increase their own profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more appliances to resell

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Cultivateur  de profession, Komlan est âgé de 44 ans et est marié à une ménagère. Ensemble, ils ont douze enfants dont sept sont scolarisés. Le plus grand est âgé de 18 ans et le dernier de 08 mois. Son activité se porte principalement sur la culture du soja dans la région centrale du Togo depuis 1987. Ce dernier travaille avec l’aide de six employés et 05 membres de sa famille et dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de tous enfants, il sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de WAGES destiné à l’amélioration de son rendement. Il souhaite utiliser ses revenus supplémentaires pour constituer assez d’épargne. Comme perspectives d’avenir, Komlan espère augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
A farmer by trade, Komlan is 44 years old and is married to a housewife. Together they have twelve children, seven of whom go to school. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest just 8 months. His activity is focused mainly on growing soy in the central region of Togo since 1987.
He works with the assistance of six employees and five members of his family. With the intention of meeting the needs of all his children, he is seeking a loan with WAGES for the first time - in order to increase his yield. He plans to use his extra income to build up adequate savings. As for the future, Komlan hopes to increase the size of his land under crop, and to build a home for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hand tools.

loans.name: Raida'a

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Raida'a prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Raida'a is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Koorah, Jordan, who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture and new electronic appliances. She hopes in the future to add another room

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Mariatu. She is married and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 4 years old. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling. In 1997, Mariatu established her clothing, cell phone, and slipper business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to increase her stock of slippers and clothing to meet the demand of her customers. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Al-Dobla Group

texts.en:
This group, Al-Dobla, consists of four members: three women and one man. They are from Aden, Yemen and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for a long time. All of their projects are home-based; however, they have many clients, mostly women. All of the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. This group received a loan of 200,000 YER. 

Hana is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Aden. She is an affectionate member of this group and she is very happy because her business has improved little by little (she is the woman who is sitting down on the right). She has been distributing mobile recharge cards and perfumes. She started the business to help her family with their children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. She distributes her mobile recharge cards to call centers and she distributes her perfumes to cosmetic shops in order to earn additional profit. She loves her work and aspires to continue it. For this reason, she is asking for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to continue buying mobile recharge cards and perfumes that will help her to earn more profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharge cards and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Paynesville South with her husband and a 12-year-old child who is attending school. She stopped her education in the 6th grade, and her husband is a business man. For the past ten years she has been selling flour, sugar, butter, baking powder, cooking oil, and many other items. She makes a profit from this because she is the only one selling in the community. With the profit generated she buys more goods to improve the business and repays the loan. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more cooking oil, flour, butter, and sugar for the business. Her plan is to build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, flour, butter, sugar, for the business

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 28-year-old, married female from Al-Bayader, Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a 1500 JOD loan to buy clothes to sell from her house. In the future she would like to have her own shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Asmaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Due to cultural reasons Asmaa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Samira prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Samira is a 46-year-old married female from Sahab, Jordan. she has 4 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. In the future, she is looking forward to do more home improvements, to paint and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses

loans.name: Mirna Cristabel

texts.es:
Mirna, se encuentra sin mucho capital en su negocio de venta de ropa y cosmeticos, por eso esta nuevamente solicitándo un crédito para la compra de camisas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, polvos, rubores, lápiz para ojos, lápiz labial, mascaras, brillos, bases, y todo lo necesario para sustentar su negocio.

Ella comenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar en sus ingresos económicos, por el momento se encuentra  estable con su familia y trabajando diariamente.
texts.en:
Mirna does not have much money to invest in her clothing and cosmetics business, therefore she is requesting a new loan for the purchase of shirts, dresses, skirts, pants, underwear, powders, blushes, eye pencil, lipstick, mascaras, glosses, foundations and all products necessary to support her business.

She mentions that, thanks to the previous loan, she was able to meet the demand of her customers and improve her profits. For now, she is in a stable situation with her family and is working daily.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, skirts, pants and underwear [product inventory].

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional toys, notebooks and bags to sell in the market. This loan will help her expand the products she sells to her customers. It will also help her increase her profits.

Through her business of selling school supplies, belts and stuffed toys over 30 years, she has been able to send her four children to school. Three of them are professionals. Now, her ultimate dream is to support her youngest child, who is about to graduate in 2013, in pursuit of a college education. 
 
To Francisca, no matter how hard life is, she is determined to give her children a better life. Her only secrets in pursuing this goal are a deep faith in God, patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional toys, notebooks and bags to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 41-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and lives with his parents. He and his father are trying their best to earn additional income for the family and enhance their way of life. 

Mostafa has owned a mini-market for a few years. He has grown in this occupation, after working non-stop and without forgetting his father’s support. Mostafa sells all kinds of food, soft drinks and many other diverse products. Because he wishes to further develop his business, he has decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory of goods. 

Mostafa wishes to get married and have children. It’s never too late for him if he improves his business and collects enough money to be able to offer his future family a respectable life.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of goods

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is a 53-year-old married woman from Malingin, Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fish vending and drying business for 30 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.
Ma. Nenita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat, etc. With this loan, her husband will be able to increase his daily catch.
In the future, Ma. Nenita hopes to expand her business and make it sustainable. Moreover, she wants to continue to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials: fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat, etc.

loans.name: Bazl

texts.en:
Bazl is 28 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who devotes the whole day to this business to help his family. He has been operating a spice store for many years. He feels that his business is reasonably profitable, based on the earnings it provides. He generally sells everything that he has to offer. 

He intends to expand his business and stock it with food products. For that reason, he has applied to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank for a youth loan of 200,000 Yemeni rials to buy spices and other items, such as oils, sugar, rice and cookies. This is his second loan from Kiva. He says he has benefitted from the first loan and he hopes to open more spice stores to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy oils, sugar, rice, spices, cookies, soda and many other items for his business.

loans.name: Elkanah

texts.en:
Elkanah is 37 years old, married to Ruth, and has been blessed with two children. He is a horticultural farmer and also operates an agrovet in Narok town. He has been running the business for the last five years. His monthly income is KES 50,000.


He is getting his first loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and this will assist him to purchase more seedlings and pesticides for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will make him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms. Kaneez is 49 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Kaneez’s son. She is in the general store business since last year. She started her business from a small toffee shop. Last year, she was approached by a Kashf Foundation business development officer and she decided to avail herself of a small loan in order to fast track her business growth. This played a vital role in her business's growth as she had limited excess to capital beforehand. Her husband also assists her by buying stocks of goods from the market.  He is very supportive towards her, that is why she is able to give proper time at the store. He feels proud of his wife.  

She needs a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy stocks of flour, rice, and packs of oil to meet the demand at her store. This would help her to expand her business further. She desires to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family and on the expansion of her business capital.

loans.use: To buy stocks of flour, rice and packs of oil to meet the demand at her store.

loans.name: Abdelhadi

texts.en:
Abdelhadi is a 45-year-old man. He is the married father of five sons and four daughters; three of his daughters are married. Abdelhadi works as a guard in the private sector and earns a low salary that does not cover the family's needs or pay for his children's education.

For the past four years, Abdelhadi has decided to cultivate the piece of land he owns and sell the crop to increase his income and get another source of income to help him cover the cost of living.

Abdelhadi is requesting a 2000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing seedlings and necessary fertilizers. This loan will provide him a better crop, which will increase his sales and income and improve his family's conditions.

In the future, Abdelhadi is looking to expand his work in agriculture and build a greenhouse.

This is a picture of Abdelhadi on his land next to the seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one currently in school. For the past year, Rashida has been working hard to manage her raw food selling business where she sells matooke. 

To help expand her business, Rashida has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke, and will help Rashida to generate greater profits and help her expand her business to serve more customers. Rashida hopes that in the future she will be able to to be able to cover school fees for her child. 

Rashida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke

loans.name: Haba Al-Rhman Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haba Al-Rhman, which consists of three ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. 
Saham is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four. She has been in the cloth trade business for many years. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. She is making enough to lead a decent life but said her income is not sufficient to bear all the daily expenditures of her family members alone. She is highly-contributing to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a wide variety of clothes and in larger quantities to add to her new ones.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes and in larger quantities for her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a first-time borrower with this institution. He applied for a loan of three million shillings, but only one million five hundred thousand shillings was approved.

The purpose of this loan is to put a roof on his house, which is currently under construction. He will also use part of it for his fish vending business. Moses buys fish from fish mongers who operate in the nearby bodies of water. He then sells them to markets and individuals. Moses has done this business for the last three years and has been able to purchase a plot of land on which he is constructing a house. However, Moses has problems with the fluctuating prices for fish, unreliable weather patterns, which affect the availability of fish, and limited capital, which hinders him from buying enough fish to sell. This is why he is applying for a loan. Moses dreams that with this loan, he will be able to put a roof on his house and stop renting, which is too costly for him. 

The picture shows Moses holding one of the fish he sells.

loans.use: to complete his house

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 7 years. She describes herself as a humble and business-minded woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells groceries, such as sugar, salt, margarine, and cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Tabitha's business is in an ideal location, and her primary customers live nearby. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy groceries to sell. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a wholesale store and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betsaida Baco Group

texts.en:
Mireille is the leader of the Community Bank named “Betsaida Baco,” which is composed of six members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mireille has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. She operates a hair salon in her area. She works hard with good management skills, in order to realize her dream of opening a larger hair salon in her environment some day. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, in which she earns about $60US per week. Mireille has already obtained and correctly repaid eleven loans from HOPE DRC microfinance institution. She will increase her stock of merchandise with this loan, by buying hair products in bulk for her business. Mireille is 29 years old, single, and the mother of four children, whose ages range from three to eight years. Three of her children attend school.

loans.use: to increase her salon’s stock by buying hair products in bulk.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine  is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of making and selling local brew, and she sells to all categories of people, at retail. Josephine has applied for a loan of 500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, to buy more bags of millet, cassava flour and firewood. She has been in the brewing business for three years. Her major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully-stocked pub selling local brew, and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of millet, cassava flour and firewood, which she will use to make local brew.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms Sajida is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She has been in the business of glove making for five years. The boy shown in the photo is Sajida’s son, who also assists her in this activity of glove stitching. Five years ago Kashf team members approached a family of 10 subsisting on a very low income per month. The bread winner of the family was employed as a daily wage laborer at a cloth factory that was known to be exploiting its workers. The family was suffering from major financial challenges when Sajida, who was then a housewife, decided to take her first loan. She used this money to purchase material that was required to stitch gloves.

Desperate to support her children who were growing up without going to school, Sajida took her gloves to the market and sold them at a minimal price. Buyers liked her gloves and demanded more. While talking to the Kashf team recently she was delighted to share her business experience and how she has been able to financially progress because of a healthy relationship with Kashf. She said she worried because unlike many other children in her neighborhood her sons and daughters were unable to attend school. Now, as her business is growing and she is able to establish a stable clientele, her children are attending school. 

She is been in association with Kashf for five years. She has shown excellent repayment behavior. At present, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy winter fabric and leather in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She hopes to earn large profits due to the increase in sales during the winter season. She dreams of building her own house and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of the family.

loans.use: to buy winter fabric and leather in large quantity to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Barzan's Group

texts.en:
Barzan is a 31-year-old, hardworking, young Iraqi man. He is married and by profession he is an electrician. 

He has a work station set-up at his home, and for the past three years he has been working at construction sites of new buildings as well as improving older homes. In the past he took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to purchase good quality tools and raw materials for his work. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, he now took a new loan to improve and expand his work station and be able to take on larger projects. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve and expand his work station and be able to take on larger projects.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah Anyango is a 41-year-old poultry farmer in Mombasa. She is married mother of five and has been doing this business for the last ten years with success. She also sells clothes and shoes to supplement her income.

This is her third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks for rearing in her farm. She sells chickens and eggs to her customers. 

The proceeds from the business will be used in the expansion of her business and repaying her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Kalamereh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the "Kalamereh II" group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Adikalie is the leader of this group. Adikalie is 42 years old, married, and has nine children: three are in primary school, five are in secondary school, and the last is not of school-going age. Adikalie sells ready-to-wear clothing and second-hand bags. He has been doing business for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, Adikalie will invest in his business by buying a large quantity of ready-to-wear clothing to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of ready-to-wear clothing to add to his current stock

loans.name: David Saffa's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni is very pleased to present you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 5,300,000 in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Aiah is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Gandorhun. He is 41 years old, married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and the other is not yet of school-going age. Aiah has been a teacher for 19 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, sand, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: buy materials to build his house

loans.name: Confidence Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Confidence” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. The 27-year-old is married to a trader, and they have two children. Mariama has been a businesswoman for five years; she sells market food -- rice, onions, pepper, palm oil (the country's most poplar cooking oil), salt, etc. Mariama has applied for this loan in order to buy a large quantity of rice, onions, pepper, palm oil, salt, etc., to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is Edward, loan officer in charge of the group)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, onions, pepper, palm oil, salt, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sabaty Group

texts.en:
Feremusu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Feremusu was born in Nimikoro village, near Koidu city, in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is 37 years of age. She is married to a trader, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school. Feremusu sells ready-to-wear clothes, “Bamako” cloths, etc. She has been a businesswoman for nine years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Feremusu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Feremusu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy ready-to-wear clothes, Bamako cloths, etc., for sale.
 
(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes, Bamako cloths, etc. for sale

loans.name: Subeh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Subeh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member of the group in order to further expand their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu. She is 32 years old. She was born in the village of Sanda, near Makeni, but she currently resides in Makeni city with her husband and child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is not of school-going age. For four years now, Mariatu has been selling slippers. With this loan, she will buy a wide variety of slippers at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of slippers at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Leh We Help Weself Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Leh We Help Weself” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Finda is the leader of this group. Finda is 45 years old, married, and has four children, two in primary school and two in secondary school. Finda sells market food: margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), pepper, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Finda will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. (Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to invest in his businesses. 

Mohamed bakes and sells breads and cakes. He has been a professional baker and bread/cakes sellers for 10 years now. A husband and a father of four children attending secondary and tertiary institutions, the 53-year-old man was born in Tonkolili district but now lives and sells in Kabala town. 

Mohamed has requested this loan in order to buy flour, sugars, yeast and other baking materials in bulk in order to bake a larger quantity of breads and cakes for sale.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugars, yeast and other baking materials in bulk in order to bake a larger quantity of breads and cakes for sale.

loans.name: God Gee Women-Ii Group

texts.en:
Mariama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Gbense village 40 years ago. She is married to a diamond miner and farmer with whom she has 6 children, 2 in primary school and 4 in secondary school. For 3 years now, Mariama has been selling cloths – cotton cloths, wax cloths, lace cloths, etc.

This is the first loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT and Kiva lenders. (Their loan officer, Edward, is also included in the photo, handing them the loan). With the help of this loan, the members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan--500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL)--to expand her business. She will buy a wide variety of cloths in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Magret Jattu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Magret Jattu, a petty businesswoman in the eastern city of Kenema. 

Born in Kono, this 39-year-old woman is married to a teacher, and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Magret has been a businesswoman for 10 years now; she sells ladies' clothing, men's clothing, mobile phones, etc. She has requested this loan in order to buy both men's and ladies' clothes in bulk to add to her boutique.

loans.use: to buy both men and ladies' clothes in bulk to add to her boutique.

loans.name: Ahmed F.

texts.en: Here is Ahmed, a small scale businessman in Kabala, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Ahmed sells calendars and tissues. He has been doing this business for many years now. With a loan of 6,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones, Ahmed will be able to buy more calendars and tissues to add to his business. Ahmed is single with one child attending primary school.

loans.use: to buy more calendars and tissues to add to his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different kinds of ready-to-wear and clothes in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Kutta

texts.en:
Pictured here is Kutta. The 40-year-old woman was born in Sinkunia. She is married and has three children. Kutta is married to a health worker and her children are attending secondary schools. 

For over 10 years now, Kutta has been selling shoes/slippers as well as bowls, dishes, pans, etc. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes/slippers as well as bowls, dishes, pans, etc. at wholesale to add to her existing stock.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tawopaneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member of the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Haja. Haja is 28 years old. She was born in Makeni city, where she currently resides with her husband and child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is attending primary school. For five years now,  Haja has been selling ready-to-wear clothes and cloth. With this loan, she will buy ready-to-wear clothes and cloth in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes and cloth in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of Bamako cloth to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hold Tight” group from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.
 
Margret is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old woman is married to a trader and they have two children. Margret has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells pepper. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of pepper to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of pepper to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha vive en la zona  del plan 3000 en casa propia sigue con la misma actividad de elaboración y venta de comida,  la señora Mirtha  se dedica a la venta de comida los platos que elabora son de pollo, bife, milanesa de pollo, asado de chancho, chicha de maíz y otros, su esposo don Guillermo es enfermo y de esta manera el colabora con los gastos del hogar, le fue bien con el anterior credito y en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite y fideo para la elaboracion de sus comidas.
texts.en: Mirtha lives in an area called Plan 3000. She owns her home and is still preparing and selling food. Mirtha sells dishes she prepares such as chicken, beef, grilled pork,  chicken milanese, chicha de maíz and more. Her husband, Guillermo, is sick, and this is how she helps support the home. It went well for her with the previous loan and at this time she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, and pasta to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her food

loans.name: Eduardo Luis
