texts.es: Eduardo Luis de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas rábanos y cilantro, también cultiva maíz y ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura lo que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, posee suelo fértil y apto para la siembra, el producto lo comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Eduardo es un hombre emprendedor, amable y servicial siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido al clima y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, rábano, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Eduardo Luis tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eduardo Luis is twenty two years old. Hw lives with his life's companiona nd their son. He grows vegetables such as radishes and cilantro. He also grows corn. He has been working in agriculture for several years, which allows him to obtain the best harvests. His cropland is located in an area with a lot of agriculture. It has fertile soil suitable for planting. He sells the product in the surrounding area and has gained many customers who prefer his quality, good prices and above all his excellent service. Eduardo is an enterprising, kind and helpful man. He is always looking out for new opportunities that allow him to be succesful. Last planting season he suffered some losses due to the weather and he wants to recover.That is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and radish seed, insecticide, herbicide and more. Eduardo Luis has good credit references and is very responsible. He is certain he can pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn and radish seeds and insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es: El Sr. Anastacio tiene 38 años es soltero,  el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Forestal,  este préstamo es el su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Anastacio va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa, yuca  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Anastacio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente.
texts.en: Anastacio is 38 years old and single. He works in agriculture, planting a variety of vegetables and potatoes and yucca. His land parcel is located in the community of Forestal. This loan is his first cycle with the institution. Anastacio is going to use this loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes and yucca. This means he will have to prepare the soil. His reason for asking for this loan is to have the resources to do the planting and be able to subsist. Anastacio faces challenges in his business such as bad weather which often ruin the plantings. He will use the profits to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potatoes and yucca.

loans.name: Janlai Lengnu Group

texts.en:
Pi.Neilam, raising her hand in the group photo, is 40 years of age. She has one son and one daughter. She is a member of a group called Janlai Lengnu; its literal meaning is 'queen of the night'. Most of its members reside in and around Saikul and are doing small business at the Saikul bazaar. Saikul is a small town in Manipur, one of the seven sister states in the northeastern part of India.
 
Previously Pi.Neilam ran a small tea stall at Saikul bazaar all by herself but found it not so profitable, as there are a good number of tea stalls in the area. She wanted to venture into the garment business as there is scope to make good business but she didn’t have enough money to start with. She, along with other members of Janlai Lengnu group, approached the WSDS branch office at Saikul and sought a loan. After all the formalities, each member received a loan of INR 5000.

 With the loan amount plus some of her own money, Pi.Neilam went to Moreh, a small town near the Myanmar border well known for its foreign goods, and purchased garments wholesale to be resold at Saikul bazaar. Clothes seen hanging behind the group picture is the one showcase for selling by Pi.Neilam. She sells ladies' clothes, men’s wear like T-shirts, jean pants and clothing for children.  

With the approach of festivals like Diwali, Durga Puja and Christmas she is desperately in need of money to add garments in her stall. She is asking for loan of INR 10,000 for her business. With the profits earned she plans to enroll her children in a better school.

loans.use: to expand her garment stall by adding more clothes in view of the coming festivals like Diwali, Durga Puja and Christmas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for his flower shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая девушка. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. После занятий в школе она работала на поле, чтобы заработать деньги и помогать родителям. В целях повышения своей навыки Шохсанам приняла участие на тренинге «Добейся успеха» проведённого Национальной Ассоциации Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес скотоводством. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohsanam is a very hardworking and dedicated girl. She was born in a rural area and has considerable experience in animal husbandry and crop farming. When she was in school, she worked in the field after her classes to earn money for her family. 

In order to learn a new skill, Shohsanam participated in the training "Bring It On" organized by the National Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She plans to start her own animal husbandry business. Therefore, she is requesting a 8000 somoni loan to purchase cattle. She is waiting on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Ayeseh

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Ayeseh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Ayeseh is a 48-year-old married woman who has four family members from Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy electronic appliances. She wants in the future to add another room to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 51 years old and widowed with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. 

Tita requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 16 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tita would like to save enough to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и его доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Мухаббат  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, but his income is not enough to support all their families needs. Muhabbat decided to help her husband provide for their family. Hence, she participated in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she is capable of successfully starting her own business. She wants to start a men's clothing business. With the income she makes, she plans to provide her children with a good education and a healthy diet. She is requesting a 15000 sumoni loan to purchase goods for her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy clothes to start a new business

loans.name: Lyubat

texts.ru: Любат проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Любат медсестра по специальности. Она восемь лет проработала по специальности. Вот уже пятнадцать лет она занимается торговлей. Любат открыла продуктовый магазин, где она работает продавщицей. В торговле ей помогает ее муж и сын. Любат берет кредит для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Lyubat is a 52-year-old woman living in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is married with two children. Lyubat is a nurse by education. She worked in this field for eight years, but for 15 years now she has been working in business. Lyubat opened her own general store, where she works as a saleswoman. Her husband and son help her with the business. She would like this loan to purchase products for her store.

loans.use: to purchase sausage, butter, soft drinks, dairy products, condensed milk, candy, cookies, chocolate, and wafers

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: Isabel del Carmen de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, la tierra de cultivo tiene un alto potencial agrícola y un suelo muy fértil además esta cercano a su vivienda, todo lo producido lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio excelente; Isabel es una mujer amable, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo porque sabe que asi alcanzara cada una de las metas que se proponga, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Isabel del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Isabel del Carmen, 24, lives with her family and makes a living growing corn and beans.  She has several years of experience in agriculture and this has given her a lot of experience, which allows her to get the best harvests.  The land she cultivates has a high growing potential and very fertile soil.  It's also close to her home.  She sells everything she produces around her community.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her for the quality, good prices, and especially her excellent service.

Isabel is a pleasant, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  Every day she makes the maximum effort because she knows that's how she'll realize every one of her goals.

In the last planting season she had some losses and wants to recover.  She needs to invest, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy corn seed, beans, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

Isabel del Carmen has a good payment record among her acquaintances and is very responsible.  She's certain that she'll be able to repay the debt within the established time period and also trusts that she'll bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, insecticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: La señorita Sara Maria  de 30 años de edad   quien vive en San Raymundo  tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diario ( jabón, golosinas  y pastas)  ubicada en su domicilio desde hace  9 años,  también como actividad secundaria elabora y vende comida, ella necesita otro crédito para la compra de productos comestibles y surtir su negocio y también para la venta de comida que tiene, ya que durante la primera semana de noviembre  que se festeja el día de todos los santos (1ro de noviembre)aprovecha esa semana para tener mayores ingreso, también quiere empezar a comprar productos navideños ya que se acerca la época en que se vende mucho ese producto y si los compra con tiempo es más barato, su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo  y surtir  su tienda de esa misma forma poder ser un aporte económico en su familia siendo la única persona soltera que vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Sara Maria is 30 years old and lives in San Raymundo. She operates a store connected to her house where she sells groceries and basic goods like soap, candy, and pasta. She has run this store for 9 years and she supplements this income by also preparing and selling food. 

Sara Maria needs a loan to buy groceries to stock her store and to help her make and sell prepared foods. During the first week of November, her hometown celebrates the festival of the Day of the Dead. Sara Maria will take advantage of this week to increase her business and earnings. She also wants to begin to buy Christmas products since the Christmas buying season is coming. If she buys these products for her store now, it is cheaper than waiting.

Sara Maria's dream is to continue to expand and stock her store and, in this way, provide financial support to her family because she is the only single child that lives with her parents.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! La Sra. Julia es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Moron”, un grupo conformado por 6 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Julia  se dedica a la venta de comida , pescado, hígado frito y también gaseosas, lleva trabajando en este negocio desde hace 18 años. Trabaja  de noche en un puesto en su casa.

Julia a solicitado el préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir, polos pantalón, chalecos ya que piensa invertir en este nuevo negocio . Su sueño es un día tener un puesto propio  y que su negocio siga creciendo.

Julia es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Julia ha comprado sillas y muebles para su casa y sus hijos cuentan con educación. Julia está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Julia is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Morón Communal Bank, a group made up of six members who make a living in a variety of commercial activities.

Julia makes a living selling food, fish, fried liver, and also soda.  She has worked in this business for 18 years.  She works at night in a stall in her house.

Julia has requested the loan to buy clothing, polo shirts, pants, and jackets because she plans to invest in this new business.

Julia is married and has seven children.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, Julia has bought chairs and furniture for her house and her children have an education.  Her dream is to have her own place one day and for her business to keep growing.

Julia is very happy about this loan and is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothing, polo shirts, pants, and jackets

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
Onorina es miembro de la alcancía Futuro Para el Bien por más de 06 años.
Onorina tiene 52 años. Junto a su pareja conviven desde muy jóvenes, ambos tuvieron un hijo que falleció prematuramente, en la actualidad viven con un sobrino que es como un hijo para ellos. Cuando  conoció a su esposo él era cerrajero y trabajaba vendiendo todo tipo de muebles. Onorina aprendió a vender por su esposo y  fue así  que abrió un local en su casa para dedicarse a la venta de muebles,  ya son cerca de 09 años que se dedica a este negocio donde  tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y seguir invirtiendo en su mismo negocio, este crédito que le otorga Edaprospo lo usara para adquirir diferentes muebles como vitrinas, roperos y estantes. En el futuro desea terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su negocio en un local más grande.
Onorina agradece el apoyo a los inversionistas KIVA, quienes hacen posible que ella continúe con sus sueños
*Onorina viste compa negra y polo verde.
texts.en:
Onorina, 52, has been a member of Futuro para el Bien Communal Bank for more than six years.  She and her partner have lived together since they were very young.  They had a child who died prematurely.  Currently they live with a nephew who is like a son to them.

When she met her husband he was a locksmith and worked selling all types of furniture.  Onorina learned sales from her husband, and that's how she opened a store in her house to make a living selling furniture.  She has been working in this business for about nine years and has a lot of customers.  Thanks to her job she can pay her household expenses and continue investing in her business.

She'll use this loan from Edaprospo to get various pieces of furniture, such as display cases, wardrobes, and shelves.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and expand her business into a bigger store.

Onorina is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders, who make it possible for her to continue with her dreams.

*Onorina is wearing a black jacket and green polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El joven Gilberto es originario de la ciudad de Veracruz, tiene ya mas de siete años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Por el momento vive solo ya que toda su familia esta en Veracruz, espera que pronta traer a sus papa a vivir con el.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para instalar una puerta más resistente y segura al frente y en la puerta trasera de la cas,   ya que ha sido victima de robos en su domicilio.
El joven Gilberto es empleado de una fábrica en el aria de producción y con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo planea pagar el crédito, ya que cuenta con otro ingreso que es de animador de fiestas con el cual solventara sus gastos.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a young man who is a native of the city of Veracruz.  He has been living in Nuevo Laredo for more than seven years.  At the moment he lives alone because his entire family is in Veracruz.  He hopes to bring his father to live with him soon.

He's requesting a loan to install stronger and safer front and back doors because his house has been robbed.

Gilberto is an employee of a factory in the area of production.  He plans to repay the loan with the salary from his job, because he has another income as a party promoter with which he'll pay his expenses.

loans.use: to install doors

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 42 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin. She is married with 2 children. 

Verginia has a mudboat and rice tracer business. Verginia has had this business for 10 years.  Verginia requested a loan of PHP 14900 to purchase additional materials for mudboat and rice tracer making.

Verginia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for mudboat and rice tracer making

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un joven de 25 años de edad, soltero y vive en Sololá. Una persona que junto a sus padres se apoyan para mejorar la economía de su familia.
El actualmente se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en una tienda en el mercado de su comunidad. Empezó esta actividad junto a su padre hace 8 años cuando viendo que las ganancias de este negocio son buenas. 
Ahora en esta temporada del año  ha visto que la demanda de los clientes aumenta, por que existen productos que el no vende pero los clientes lo piden para su consumo.
De este modo desea invertir más capital en su negocio con un crédito de Q 6,000.00 comprando mas abarrotes y teniendo una variedad para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Tener otra tienda de abarrotes  es el sueño  junto a su familia para seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 25-year-old young man, is single, and lives in Sololá.  He is a person who works together with his parents to support each other in order to improve the financial situation of his family.  He currently makes a living through selling groceries at a store in the market in his community.  He began this work with his father eight years ago when he saw that the profits from this business were good.

Now at this time of year he has seen the demand from the customers increase because there are products that he does not sell but that the customers request for their consumption.  In this way he wishes to invest more capital in his business with a loan of 6,000.00 quetzales to buy more groceries and have a variety to be able to offer his customers.  His dream is to have another grocery store with his family in order to continue improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock up his store.

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en: Nolie, pictured beside the truck she plans to repair, is 48 years old and married. For the past year, she has been transporting goods, which has been a profitable venture. Nolie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva to help her cover the costs of repairing her truck. This will enable Nolie to travel from one place to another to expand her work and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with one child. She is 26 years old and resides at Baliangao, in the province of Misamis Occidental. Jennifer plants, harvests, and sells bananas to earn a living. She been doing this for 5 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy farm chemicals.

Jennifer has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Ms. Irum is a 29-year-old housewife. Her husband has been in the vehicle-painting business for ten years. The man shown in the photo is the client’s husband. Her husband is the sole earner of their household. They live with their large, traditional family including grandparents and other relatives. Irum couldn't go out to assist her husband's work. She is supposed to stay at home to cater her in-laws and perform the duties of cooking, dish-washing and cleaning home all day. She is to be his helper by working at home. 

Irum knew that her husband's income was not sufficient to cover the family's expenditures alone, and he was not able to grow his business with limited resources. So she suggested that he must take a loan from Kashf to expand his business. He has gradually improved his business because of it. 

Now Irum has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more buckets of paints in various colors. Her husband hopes to grow his business and dreams of giving good, quality food to all of his family members through all of his hard work in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more buckets of paints in various colors for the vehicle-painting business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with three children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Erlinda is a farmer and grows rice and coco palm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan of 20000 PHP to  purchase fertilizers for her farm inputs .

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm inputs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 25 years old and single.  He sells assorted goods in Voi, which he has been doing for three years. He earns a monthly income of 19,800 KES. 

Patrick is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more wristwatches, torches, basins, key holders, and knives. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a motorbike to aid him in transporting his goods. He hopes to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase wristwatches, torches, basins, key holders, and knives.

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is married and has two children. He is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Bienvenido is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. Bienvenido has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Bienvenido has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, he hopes to expand his rice field some day.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann is 28 years old and lives in Aquino, Tangub City. She is married with 3 children. Rose Ann works in the fish industry with her husband, who helps her to sell fish for a living. She earns 300 per day. Rose Ann requested a loan to  purchase more fish to sell. Rose Ann is a new member of PMPC; she joined 2 months ago. In the future, Rose Ann hopes that her type of living will go better.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 45 years old and married to Santi who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children: Roshellin and Caren Joy. With good relationships in the family, Merlita is really inspired to pursue the business she started because she wants to finance her youngest daughter's college education. They live in Ilagan municipality. Merlita shared also that the village where they live is a faraway rural place and mountainous.

Merlita wants to request a loan of PHP 40,000 that will be very helpful to her new rice vending business. According to her, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed for her business since they are in demand for her additional business. The products will be sold at retail prices in order to generate more income for her family and money for school fees for her children. She hopes to upgrade her business through her strong determination, for she believes that with this, she will be able to succeed in all her goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and feed to sell for her new business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn, aged 43, would like to borrow the amount of PHP 7,000 which she can use to maintain her sari-sari store business. She will use the money to purchase soft drinks, noodles, salt, oil, vinegar, soy sauce, spices, and junk foods. She is serious about her business since this is her only source of income. Analyn is hoping that her business will prosper so her family will have a better life. She is also planning to venture into a vegetable vending business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, noodles, salt, oil, vinegar, soy sauce, spices, and junk foods

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is already 44 years old. She is married to Melvito who happens to be a "Barangay" treasurer in their village. They are blessed with four children of whom two are still studying. Their family lives on the mountainside of Capellan. Magelyn manages her direct-selling business in which she invites most of her neighbors and friends to place their orders from her Avon, Natasha and MSE brochures. 

To further increase her credit line with these companies, she is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 from Kiva lenders. Magelyn also wants to help her husband to purchase other necessary items for their farm, like fertilizers, pesticides and so on, by increasing her commissions from her direct-selling business. They are hoping to have development and growth both in her direct-selling business and in their agriculture business managed by her husband. They also hope to give their children a complete education, especially for those who are interested in studying.

loans.use: To buy umbrella, detergents, beauty soap and shampoo for her store

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 33 years old, married, and has children who attend school.  She is from the remote area of Maluno Sur province of Isabela. Her husband is a farmer. She does everything just to give her family what they need.  

May is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy products for her general store.  She hopes that someday she can see her children walking with their diplomas.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snack foods, beverages, and boxes of candies.

loans.name: Loddy

texts.en:
Loddy is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  She is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Loddy is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds for her ducks.  She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 48 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Lasam. She has been selling a variety of food and viands in front of their house for more than 18 years, earning approximately 250 PHP per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ma. Victoria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, meat, and soft drinks. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue to send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to reconstruct her house to make it more at ease for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 32 years old and from the remote area of Capellan province of Isabela. She is a very responsible mother who can do everything for her family.

She is engaged in selling a variety of products that she can offer in the community. She hopes that her business expands, so that she can give and sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and beverages for her store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Julius is 66 years old old, married, and has five children. He sells water as well as operating a small food cafe, which he has been doing for 12 years in Narok. His monthly income is  40,000 KES 


Julius is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more water for resale as well as manage the food cafe.  He intends to use the anticipated profits to expand the food cafe. His future dreams are to have a stable business, educate his children, and improve his family’s living standards

loans.use: to purchase water for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish.

She has been in this business for 15 years. Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicines for selling

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 34 years old,  married, and has three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years. 

Melanie is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell such as soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.  Melanie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a 1,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Rosario is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and married with one child.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, rice, candies, sugar and other grocery items.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from selling plastic wares.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, rice, candies, sugar and other grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from Avon for resale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 30 years old, married, and blessed with four children he supports. He has been a mixed-crop farmer in Narok for the past three years. His monthly income is KES 25,000. With his second loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 20,000, he plans to purchase livestock and prepare his farm for planting.

He intends to use the anticipated profits in his business. His dreams for the future are to have a stable business and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and prepare his farm for planting.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 63 years old and married with eight children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (or convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like detergent bars, soft drinks and beverages.

Zenaida has been in this business for 12 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Zenaida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like detergent bars, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Ekamais

texts.en:
Ekamais has a grocery stall where he sells fruits, vegetables, maize, and beans. He started this business a year and a half ago, and earns a monthly income of 50,600 KES. 

He has requested for a second loan of 89,000 KES to purchase fruits, and bags of maize and beans for sale. The profit made will contribute towards him buying a piece of land and building rental houses to let.

His dream is to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, maize, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mehdad

texts.en:
Mehdad is a 26-year-old single man who has been selling coffee and hot drinks for 10 years. He is a hard worker; he puts a lot of effort into improving his business in order to improve his living, and develop his working zone.

Mehdad has applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to open a  convenience store to increase his income. His plan is to convert this store to a supermarket in a short period of time.

Mehdad sells hot and cold beverages, Hookas, and sandwiches. His shop is located in a commercial area, which is very important for improving and developing his business sectors.

Mehdad's customers support him a lot, and trust his quality. He hopes to keep providing his customers the best service ever, and continue developing his financial situation to start planning his own family.

loans.use: To open a  convenience store to increase his income.

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
Lhingneichong, who raised her hand in the picture, is 38 years old and lives at L.Hengjang, a small tribal village in Manipur, a state in the northeastern part of India. Villagers of L.Hengjang have practically no access to financial assistance, not even in the form of loans. Due to poverty and shortage of capital money, they are not able to take up income-generating activity.

Lhingneichong and her husband are a hardworking couple who have three school-going children. Though her husband works as a carpenter, his income is inadequate to meet their day-to-day household needs and the children’s educational expenses.
	
In 2009 Lhingneichong learned about WSDS disbursing loans to women's groups in the neighboring locality. To avail herself of this opportunity, she, along with four other women of the village, formed Sarah group and underwent compulsory group training conducted by WSDS. On completion of the training, Lhingneichong and other members of the group received INR 5,000 each as loans. 

With the loan, she bought two piglets and with the remaining amount she built pig sty. Feeding her pigs involves a good amount of hard labor. She walks down to Leimakhong (market place), which is about 2 kms, to collect feed for her pigs. During day time she works in her small agricultural land where she cultivates potatoes, cabbages and many other vegetables for her household consumption and sale in the market. 

Now she wants to avail herself of another loan of INR 10,000 to purchase four or five piglets depending on the price. And by next year with the amount she gets from the sale of these pigs, she wishes to start a small general shop in the village. She is hopeful that with God’s grace her cherished dream of having her own general store and providing proper education to her children will surely come true.

loans.use: to purchase four or five piglets.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es: Oscar Mauricio de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y vacas adicional a esto se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios  de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de  cultivo tiene gran potencial agrícola, todo lo que comercia lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad donde vive y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo con un servicio inigualable; Oscar es un hombre emprendedor, luchador y muy humilde, todos los días se dedica al máximo a su trabajo porque sabe que asi alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar ganado, semilla de maíz, insecticida etc. Oscar Mauricio tiene buenas referencias de pago, y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Oscar Mauricio, 29, lives with his family.  He makes a living raising pigs and cows, and also grows corn.  He has worked in agriculture for several years, which has given him a lot of experience, allowing him to get the best harvests.  His cropland has great growing potential.  He sells everything he grows around the community where he lives, and he has a lot of customers who prefer him for the quality, good prices, and especially his incomparable service.

Oscar's an enterprising and very humble man and a fighter who dedicates himself to the maximum degree every day because he knows that he'll achieve the success he wants so much.

In the last growing season he had some losses and he wants to recover.  He needs capital so he's asking Integral for a loan to buy livestock, corn seed, insecticide, etc.

Oscar Mauricio has a good payment record and is very responsible.  He's certain that he'll be able to repay the debt and also trusts that he'll bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy livestock, corn seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Rany sells groceries item at home. In addition, she also supplements new pig farming business. Her husband is a policeman. 

Rany and her husband have been married since 1999 and they have three children-one son and two daughters. Two attend school and another one is still young. 

Rany had asked for Kiva loan (http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/245150). She now is now applying for another loan in the amount of $1,500 to assist in his pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 58-year-old married man from Sikatuna, Bohol. He has three children. The oldest child is 40 years old.

Antonio has been in the hog-raising business for two years. He plans to use his loan to buy additional piglets and feeds like hog booster, hog starter mash and hog finisher. In the future, Antonio would like to expand his business to invest in other ventures to support his family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Almacita

texts.en:
Almacita is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Almacita has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for five years. Almacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old and married. She has two children.

Amalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Amalia has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Amalia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lazaro Enamorado

texts.es: Lázaro Enamorado de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo es propio y tiene un gran potencial para la siembra, todo lo producido lo comercia en los diferentes alrededores de la comunidad ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente, pero Lázaro adicional a su trabajo  para complementar los gastos del hogar también cultiva melón y  además recibe un pequeño salario de cuidar dos ranchos; es un hombre emprendedor, dedicada su labor, dispuesto a buscar las mejores alternativas que le permitan alcanzar un futuro mas prospero, su mas grande secreto el amor y la constancia porque sabe que asi logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en la ultima temporada aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, melón, insecticida, herbicida y herramientas de trabajo etc. Lázaro Enamorado tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Lázaro Enamorado is 53 years old, and he lives with his family.  He is a farmer; he grows corn and sorghum.  He has been doing this line of work for several years.  This has gifted him with a lot of experience that allows him to get the best harvests.  The land he cultivates is his own, and it has a great potential for planting.  Everything he produces is preferred for its quality, the good prices, and the excellent service.

In order to supplement income for the household expenses, Lázaro also grows melon, and he gets a small salary for taking care of two ranches.  He is an enterprising man who devotes himself to his work.  His is ready and willing to look for the best alternatives that will allow him to reach a more prosperous future.

His biggest secret is love and perseverance because he knows that this way he will achieve the success he so dreams of.  During the last season demand increased, and he wants to take advantage of the demand by making a new investment.

That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy corn seeds, sorghum, melon, insecticide, herbicide, and work tools, etc.  Lázaro Enamorado has good payment references and high moral character.  He affirms that he will be able to repay the debt, and he has faith that he will provide his household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, sorghum, melon, insecticide, herbicide, and work tools, etc.

loans.name: Maira Sabrina

texts.es: Maira tiene 31 años de estado civil soltera , tiene 3 hijos . Maira tiene en su ciudad natal Manta una venta de ropa la cual empezó de manera ambulante hace varios años. Escogió esta actividad debido a las pocas oportunidades que se le presentaron para conseguir empleo y fue gracias a sus ventas que logro adquirir un local en el mercado municipal por lo que ya no necesita hacer recorridos. La atención la realiza solo y cuando hay feriado contrata a un ayudante pagando sus servicios por hora. En su local oferta blusas, camisas, camisetas, jeans, calentadores ya que es lo que más solicitan sus clientes. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones es la delincuencia ya que a veces hay mucha gente y se aglomeran lo que llena el local y pierde visión, es en ese momento que los ladrones aprovechan para robar. Espera obtener el crédito ya que desea comprar más mercadería para la venta esperando a futuro crecer hasta conseguir abrir una sucursal en otra ciudad.
texts.en: Maira is 31 years old and is unmarried with 3 children. In the city where she was born, Manta, Maira sells clothes which began as being a street vendor many years ago. She chose this trade as there are few opportunities to obtain employment and it was thanks to her sales that she was able to acquire a shop in the local market so that she doesn't need to make runs. She services the store alone and when there is a holiday she contracts an assistance, paying them hourly wages. In her shop she offers blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jeans, and sweats and that is what most customers request. One of the major concerns is the crime, as at times there are many people and it is crowded and full in the shop and she loses visibility. It is at this moment that thieves take the opportunity to steal. She hopes to obtain the loan so that she can purchase more merchandise to sell, hoping to in the future grow until she can open a branch in another city.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 63, is a widower with six children living in Masindi, Uganda.

For over ten years he has been raising sheep, turkeys, chickens and goats, and the business has a ready market. He also does crop growing.

He started on a small scale and after accumulating enough profits, bought more land and expanded. 

His dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent home and move his business into a more permanent location.

Inadequate capital, theft and high fuel prices hinder his business.

Samuel is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 61 years old, married and has seven children. 

Bernadita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Bernadita requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadita has been raising pigs for 16 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jona requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to buy a tricycle for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 22-year-old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan, who has two family members. 

She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy materials and cosmetic products for her salon. 

She wants in the the future to expand her business by opening a beauty salon because she works now in her home. Also, she hopes to increase her family income. 

Since Rawan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 62 years old and has six children. 

Consolacion is in the agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. Consolacion requested an 18,000-PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Consolacion has been farming bananas for 16 years now, and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a woman of high integrity. She has shown great interest in moving ahead. She is grateful for the support she received and that which she is currently getting. Amina says that the previous loan enabled her to increase her inventory.

Amina is requesting a new loan to expand her existing business. This is because she has seen some opportunities and she is sure that she will earn much profit from this new investment. 

With the loan, she plans to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She also wants to repair her handcart that she at times uses to supply her charcoal to her regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale and to repair her handcart.

loans.name: Zubaida  Bib

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 49-year-old married woman. She has five children, one daughter and four sons.

She started her business of sewing four years ago. Before starting her own business, her life was in crisis because her family was solely dependent on her husband’s income, which was very low to cover the daily expenses of the family members. This compelled her to learn the work of sewing, and after learning, she bought a sewing machine and started her business. 

Now two of her sons also earn by working at a barber shop while one son and her daughter attend school. 

These days, Zubaida is facing difficulties in extending her business because of low cash in hand, so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR. This will help her to buy cloth of different colors for sewing different designs to sell in the market. 

Zubaida's dream is to extend her business more with the support of Kashf Foundation and provide a better future to her children through her earnings.

loans.use: To buy cloth of different colors for sewing different designs to sell.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children that he supports. He has run a retail shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Harrison has applied for his first loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to restock his shop with a variety of petroleum products for sale.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to his business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Tawfiq

texts.en:
Tawfiq,  who appears in the picture, is a 26 year-old young man.  He is married and does not yet have children. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. Tawfiq is also a university student, specializing in a basic education.  He wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will help Tawfiq to complete his studies and ensure a better future for him, which will help to improve the family's living conditions.
Tawfiq is looking in the future to complete his studies and get another high education degree.

loans.use: To cover higher education costs

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of fou rchildren, Emelita works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Emelita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  NWTF is relisting Gemma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Ms Anila  is a 32 year-old married woman who has been in the business of stitching for the past 10 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well and serves her community well. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family.

She is the mother of three daughters and two sons.  Two daughters and a son are at school. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing and education. Currently, she is facing the problem of a shortage of basic things to complete the orders on time. She contacted Kashf foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of buttons, zips and needles to meet the customers’ orders efficiently without delay. She wishes to spend part of her income on her children’s education. She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of buttons, zips and needles to meet the customers’ orders without delay.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 50 years old and has eight children.  He lives in Masindi–Uganda.  After realizing that farming alone could not help him sustain his big family, he decided to venture into meat selling. He has been operating the butcher shop for twenty years and with the income earned he has been able to pay school fees for his children and build a house. Mario‘s dream is to educate his children up to the University despite challenges in high cost of animals and high taxes levied on him. Mario is requesting a loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Nimfa works hard to support her family. 

She has a rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nimfa is borrowing 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business. 

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old business lady who sells secondhand clothes in Voi. She is a married mother of three children aged 22, 5 and 4. She has been running a secondhand clothes retail stall for the last seven years and she is doing great. 

This will be Elizabeth's fourth business loan from KADET Ltd., with which she plans to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: Aloto-Alomin Group

texts.fr: ALOTO-ALOMIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres s’approvisionnent au même endroit et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Laure dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Laure est mariée à un certain Jules. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Laure n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de dix sept ans que Laure mène comme activité la vente des boules d’akassa et de poissons à son domicile. Laure exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Laure s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Laure sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ALOTO-ALOMIN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
ALOTO-ALOMIN is a group of three people whose members belong to the same savings group, and who buy their merchandise at the same place. The group’s representative is Laure, age 46, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Laure is married to a man named Jules. They have three children who go to school. The couple live with their children, and they handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Laure never went to school. She started to sell akassa balls (made from maize starch) and fish from her home nearly 17 years ago. She is passionate about her activity, which allows her to support herself. Laure buys her stock locally. 

To meet customer demand, she is seeking a 4th loan together with the other members of the group ALOTO-ALOMIN. This loan will help them to meet the needs of their customers and to bolster their profits. Past loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old Lebanese man. He's married and living with his wife and four children. They are all attending school. He's trying the best he can to enhance the family's way of living. 

He started working as a blacksmith few years ago and is doing the best he can to better improve and develop himself. As he wants to enlarge his business and grow in his occupation as well, Ali decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electrical generator to carry on his work in a proper way. He wishes to take bigger projects and offer his children whatever they ask for; that is the reason of why he's in a real need to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. With the cooperation of her husband, she has been able to satisfy her family needs and offer them a fair way of living. Salwa owns a small minimarket where she sells all kinds of dairy and daily-use products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. As for her husband, he works outside the country. 

Salwa realized that she needs a fair amount of money to improve her business, that's why she's asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her minimarket. In that way she will be able to diversify her items and therefore increase her revenues thus her way of living. Salwa looks forward to expanding her grocery, waiting the perfect time to open other branches and assign people to work with her.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her minimarket

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 25-year-old grocery store owner in Mariakani. She is a married mother of one child. She has been running a grocery store for the last year and she is doing great. 

This is Brenda's first business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more potatoes, oranges, cabbages, onions, tomatoes and kale from the farmers and sell to her customers who are mostly the residents of Mariakani. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child. She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, oranges, cabbages, onions, tomatoes and kale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and married with 5 children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Lourdes has been in this business for 26 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Forty-seven year old Manvel lives in Dilijan City, Tavush Province. He is married and has two sons. His elder son is a fourth year student of Yerevan State University of Architecture and Construction. He studies in the Management and Technology Department. Manvel’s younger son is a pupil.

Manvel works at Yerevan State University's Ijevan Branch as a lecturer, and he lectures on higher mathematics and informatics (the study of information processing). Manvel’s wife works at Dilijan Archives. Thanks to their jobs, Manvel and his wife support their family.    

Manvel has received loans from Nor Horizon twice, and now he needs a 220,000 AMD loan to pay for his elder son’s education at university for the first semester of the current academic year.

loans.use: to pay for his elder son’s education at university for the first semester of the current academic year

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en: Mr. Gankhuu, 24 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a ger in Khovd Province of Mongolia. His wife operates a transportation service business with Mr. Gankhuu. They sell firewood during winter and produce building blocks during summer. Mr. Gankhuu has been working as a driver with his father's car for years, and he is experienced. He needs 600,000 MNT to purchase a secondhand car to provide his own taxi service. He is a hardworking and honest man who wants to make a better life for his wife and family.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car to provide his own taxi service

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 70 years old, widowed, and has nine children.  

Elena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her pigpens and feed for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 9 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her pigpens and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 53-year-old, married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children; two of them are working and the other is still studying. They are all cooperating together wishing to enhance their life and bring added income to the family. 

Mohammad owns a small mini-market in his town. He has clients from his town and all over the neighboring villages. He’s well known for being kind and friendly with his clients even though they are visiting him for the first time. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. In that way he will be able to diversify his items, therefore increase his sales and thus respond rapidly to his client’s demands whatever they are. One of Mohammad’s greatest dreams is to offer his children a great life and see them achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market

loans.name: Olivera

texts.en:
Olivera is forty-one years old and lives in a minority community of Kosovo. She is a mother of two boys, ages six and eight years old.  The older boy is currently attending school. Olivera’s husband works as a police officer, and she is a housewife who loves her children very much and is taking care of them. For a long time they have lived in an old house.  A few years ago they were able to start building a new house but they could only finish one room, not the whole house. Olivera always wanted to have pleasant atmosphere to raise her children and had really wanted to finish the entire house to live in but they don t have enough money. 

Olivera is asking for 1.500 Euro loan in order to buy material to finish the rooms and buy windows and doors to complete the house. This loan will help them to complete their home and dreams and enjoy better living conditions.  Thay are very happy for this support and appreciate all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy material to finish the rooms and buy windows and doors

loans.name: Tobiko

texts.en:
Tobiko is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES. 40,000. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD , with which he intends to purchase farm inputs for use in his farm for better yields.  The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man, who has been working in transportation for three years. Mohamad didn't finish his elementary education because his parents couldn't afford paying for his tuition fees, which forced him to work early in order to help his parents in covering their expenses.
Mohamad started his own business a year ago, and he is working hard to improve it. His van needs maintenance.  He has to change its engine, so he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua.  He is specialized in transporting students from and to school. The only obstacle he has faced was the high price of fuel in Lebanon.
Mohamad is planning to improve and expand his business as much as he can, to improve his income and his living.

loans.use: to change his van's engine

loans.name: Nyamiryango Wns Group

texts.en:
Magret is a 47-year-old, hardworking woman with six children. She and her family live in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children to the university level. 

Magret has been a farmer for 20 years. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to venture into modern farming methods. She also has a vision of diversifying her business to new areas. 

Magret intends to use the loan to pay workers to mulch her garden. She is a member of the abovementioned group where each member guarantees to support one another.

loans.use: to pay workers to mulch her garden.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 45-year-old man. He’s married to Amina, a wonderful lady and the mother of three working children. Since their marriage, Youssef used to work under pressure, trying his best to bring added income to the family and enrich their life. 

Youssef has been working as a blacksmith since a few years ago. He owns a shop where he manufactures different types of metal upon request. He learned this profession through experience and doing the best he can to better improve and develop himself. As he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way. He wishes to take more and bigger projects to amplify his income and be able to make the needed savings for his future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Pamela works hard to support her family.

Pamela has a business selling copra (dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut) in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from frozen foods and pig fattening. Pamela is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more copra to sell.

Pamela has been able to sustain her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building her business and securing the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more copra (dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut) and sell.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 34 years old and married with four children.

Lynette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Lynette has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Lynette aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a 55-year-old, single mother of four children who are over 18 years old. Elina sells grocery goods, a business she started two years ago and earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She has requested a second loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fruits, vegetables and two bags of maize. The profit she earns will be put back into her business. 

Elina dreams of seeing her children reach higher levels of education as well as prosperity in her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits and two bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a one of the few women who do not fully rely on their spouses for their personal expenses. She is always on the lookout for new business opportunities. Thanks to her efforts and the support she gets from Yehu and Kiva, she has been able to progress in life. Bahati says that since the previous loans, her living standards have improved. She needs a loan to invest in her current business. Since the previous loan enabled her to have a business location, she was able to include the sale of more household items. She is taking out this loan to buy cereals, sacks of sugar, tea leaves, etc. This way she will continue to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sack of sugar, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Ofelia

texts.es: La socia Ofelia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 50  años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. La socia Ofelia se dedica a elaborar postres, pasteles y tortas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos por ejemplo harina, leche, huevos, margarina y otras cosas más. La socia Ofelia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Ofelia was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is fifty years old and married, and from this beautiful relationship she has three children. Ofelia works making desserts, pastries, and cakes. She's already been in this business for several years and it's going very well for her. On this occasion she needs a loan to buy supplies, for example flour, milk, eggs, margarine, and other things. Ofelia belongs to the communal bank "Los Andes," in the Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy supplies, for example flour, milk, eggs, margarine, and other things.

loans.name: Kesue

texts.en:
Kesue is 35 years old. He is married to Ireen, and together they have two children that he supports. He has run a butchery for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has applied for a business loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more animals for slaughter and add the stock of meat to his shop for sale.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with three children whom they support. 

Margaret has been running a fruit and vegetable stall in Narok for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has applied for a business loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD so she can buy more assorted fruits and vegetables.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to expand her fruit and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell for her business.

Marialyn has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Sharhuu

texts.en: Mr.Sharkhuu lives with his wife and four children in a Ger of Tosontsengel province. He is 37 years old. He has been working at a Mongolian national boots company since 2009. He also produces a small amount at home during his free time and sells them in the center of the province and throughout the countryside by order. He has already gained alot of experience and potential customers' trust in this area. His wife helps his business. His estimated monthly profit will be between 250,000-350,000 MNT. He is planning to purchase a car to distribute products throughout the countryside. Mr.Sharkhuu is requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase raw materials for traditional boots. He is a welcoming and reticent man who also has experience in furniture-making, and he has a dream of having a furniture-making business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for traditional boots

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким родился в 1963 году в городе Исфара. Женат, имеет 4-х детей. С 2005 года является активным клиентом, первый раз получил кредит в размере 500 сомони для увеличения оборотных средств. С тех пор он постоянно берет кредит, потому что таким образом может осуществить свои планы.  Муким  занимается купля-продажей риса.  Это его единственный доход в семье. На полученный кредит хочет закупить несколько мешков риса. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mukim was born in 1963 in the city of Isfara.  He is married and has four children.  He has been an active client since 2005 and obtained his first loan in the amount of 500 somoni to increase his working capital.  Since then, he has been regularly obtaining loans because this is how he is able to realize his plans.  Mukim is involved in buying and selling rice.  This is his sole source of income in the family.  He wants to use this loan to purchase several bags of rice.  He thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of rice

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en:
Zorica is a 20-year-old woman who lives in one of the vulnerable ethnic minority communities in Kosovo. She is a young mother with two children, ages 6 months and 2 years. She is a stay-at-home mother. Her husband works as a technical staff member in a primary school. They live in a small village under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. 

They are in urgent need to do some renovations to their house before the winter. Their house has not been repaired for a long time. Her house has a heat-loss problem due to poor insulation. Every winter it is very hard to keep the house warm, and her children always get sick due to the cold. For the first time, she is requesting a loan to renovate two rooms and also the bathroom in order to be ready before the winter. After repairing the house Zorica will be able to create normal living conditions for the family. Zorica appreciates the help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate rooms in her house before winter

loans.name: Emilienne Sonagnon

texts.fr: Emilienne Sonagnon est âgée 41ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle vend des tissus et des séries de bol depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est essentiellement composée des semi grossistes et des détaillants. En vue d'agrandir son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev. Ce concours financier lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'achever la construction de sa maison.
texts.en: Emilienne Sonagnon is 41 years old. She is married and has one child in school. She has  been selling fabric and sets of bowls for some years. She stocks up at one of the Benin markets. Her large and diverse customer base is mainly composed of semi-wholesalers and retailers. With the goal of expanding her working capital and meeting customer demand, she has requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This support will allow her to help pay for the education of her [child] and  finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of fabric and five sets of bowls.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой, ей необходимо провести дома ремонт.   Она хочет утеплить комнаты , потому что наступают холода.   Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации и каждый раз присылает деньги.   Также сама Зульфия работает воспитательницей в детском саду, но накопленные средства недостаточны для проведения ремонта  и утепления комнат. Для этого она просит кредит чтобы провести косметический ремонт и построить печь с удобной стороны. Она надеется на поддержку  Арванд, и ее семья думает что эту зиму они проживут в тепле и уюте.
texts.en: Zulfiya came to MDO "Arvand" for financial support because she needs to make repairs at home.  She wants to insulate rooms because the cold season is coming.
